chat.title: AI Support Assistant
chat.subtitle: Always here to help
chat.welcomeMessage: Hello! I'm your AI Support Assistant. How can I help you with DataMigrate AI today?
chat.offlineMode: Using offline mode - responses may be limited

fallback.default: I'm not sure I understand. Could you please rephrase your question? I can help you with migrations, database connections, dbt models, and AI agents.
fallback.moreDetails: I can help you with that! Could you provide more details about your migration requirements?
fallback.mssqlSupport: Great question! DataMigrate AI supports MSSQL to dbt migrations with automatic schema analysis.
fallback.createMigration: To create a new migration, go to Migrations > New Migration and follow the wizard steps.
fallback.aiAgents: Our AI agents can automatically generate dbt models, tests, and documentation for your data.
fallback.connectionIssues: If you're experiencing connection issues, please verify your SQL Server credentials and network settings.
fallback.dataPrep: You can use the DataPrep Agent to profile and clean your data before migration.
fallback.mlFineTuning: The ML Fine-Tuning agent helps optimize model performance for your specific data patterns.
fallback.documentation: Check the Documentation section for detailed guides on all features.
fallback.migrationHelp: To create a new migration, navigate to the Migrations page and click 'New Migration'. The wizard will guide you through connecting to your MSSQL database, selecting tables, and configuring your dbt project settings.
fallback.connectionHelp: For database connections, you can use either SQL Server authentication or Windows Authentication. Go to Settings > Connections to add a new connection. Make sure your SQL Server allows remote connections and the firewall permits access on port 1433.
fallback.dbtHelp: DataMigrate AI automatically generates dbt models from your MSSQL schema. It creates staging models, intermediate transformations, and can include tests and documentation. You can customize the target warehouse (Snowflake, BigQuery, Fabric, etc.) during migration setup.
fallback.agentHelp: We have several AI agents available: DataPrep Agent for data profiling and cleaning, ML Fine-Tuning Agent for optimizing transformations, Data Quality Agent for validation, and more. Access them from the Dashboard.
fallback.errorHelp: I'm sorry you're experiencing issues. Common solutions include: 1) Verify your database credentials, 2) Check network connectivity to SQL Server, 3) Ensure the user has read permissions on the database. For persistent issues, check the migration logs or contact support.
fallback.generalHelp: I can help you with: creating migrations, configuring database connections, understanding dbt models, using AI agents, and troubleshooting issues. What would you like to know more about?
fallback.validationHelp:
Validation warnings help ensure your migration is complete and follows best practices. Here's what each warning means:

**Documentation Completeness**: Tables or columns missing descriptions. Add descriptions in your source database or dbt schema.yml files.

**SQL Linting**: Code style issues detected. Review the suggested fixes to improve readability.

**Column Verification**: Mismatches between source and target columns. Check data types and naming conventions.

**Data Type Mapping**: Some data types may need manual review. Check the conversion table in our documentation.
fallback.documentationWarningHelp:
**Documentation Completeness Warning**

This warning appears when tables or columns are missing descriptions. Well-documented data models are crucial for:

1. Team collaboration
2. Data governance
3. Self-service analytics

**How to fix:**
- Add column descriptions in your MSSQL database
- Or update the generated schema.yml file with descriptions
- Use the AI Documentation agent to auto-generate descriptions
fallback.sqlLintingWarningHelp:
**SQL Linting Warning**

This warning indicates code style issues in the generated SQL. Common issues include:

1. Inconsistent naming conventions
2. Missing or extra whitespace
3. Long lines that should be wrapped
4. Unused CTEs or columns

**How to fix:**
- Review the specific linting errors shown
- Use a SQL formatter tool
- Configure sqlfluff rules in your dbt project
fallback.columnVerificationWarningHelp:
**Column SQL Verification Warning**

This warning appears when there are mismatches between source and target columns:

1. Column names don't match expected pattern
2. Data types differ from source
3. Nullable settings changed

**How to fix:**
- Review the column mapping in migration details
- Adjust data type mappings in settings
- Check for reserved keywords in target warehouse
fallback.dataTypeMappingWarningHelp:
**Data Type Mapping Warning**

Some MSSQL data types require special handling:

• **DATETIME2** → TIMESTAMP_NTZ (loses timezone)
• **MONEY** → DECIMAL(19,4)
• **GEOGRAPHY** → VARCHAR (needs custom handling)
• **HIERARCHYID** → VARCHAR

**How to fix:**
- Review the data type conversion table
- Add custom type mappings in migration settings
- Test edge cases with sample data

docs.title: Documentation
docs.subtitle: Everything you need to know about DataMigrate AI
docs.aiSupportAvailable: Our AI support assistant is available 24/7 to answer your questions.

gettingStarted.title: Getting Started
gettingStarted.description: Learn how to set up and configure DataMigrate AI for your first migration.
gettingStarted.overview: DataMigrate AI transforms your MSSQL databases into production-ready dbt projects using 8 specialized AI agents.

steps.title: 1. Create Your Account
steps.description: Sign up for a free account at datamigrate.ai. You'll receive a welcome email with login credentials.

steps.title: 2. Add Database Connection
steps.description: Navigate to Settings > Connections and add your MSSQL database. Supports SQL Server Authentication and Windows Authentication.

steps.title: 3. Start a Migration
steps.description: Click 'New Migration' from the dashboard. Select your source database and choose tables/views to migrate.

steps.title: 4. Configure Target
steps.description: Select your target data warehouse (Snowflake, Databricks, BigQuery, Redshift, or Microsoft Fabric) and enter credentials.

steps.title: 5. Review & Deploy
steps.description: Our AI agents will analyze your schema, generate dbt models, and prepare deployment scripts. Review and deploy!

databaseConnections.title: Database Connections
databaseConnections.description: Configure and manage your MSSQL database connections securely.
databaseConnections.overview: Securely connect to your MSSQL databases using industry-standard encryption.

steps.title: SQL Server Authentication
steps.description: Provide server hostname, port (default 1433), database name, username, and password.

steps.title: Windows Authentication
steps.description: Use your Windows domain credentials. Format: DOMAIN\username

steps.title: Connection Testing
steps.description: Always test your connection before saving. We verify connectivity and list available tables.

steps.title: Security Best Practices
steps.description: Use read-only accounts with minimum required permissions. All credentials are encrypted at rest.

migrationGuide.title: Migration Guide
migrationGuide.description: Step-by-step guide to migrating your MSSQL databases to dbt projects.
migrationGuide.overview: Our AI agents handle complex schema analysis, data type mapping, and relationship detection automatically.

steps.title: Table Selection
steps.description: Choose which tables and views to include. Use the search and filter to find specific objects.

steps.title: Schema Analysis
steps.description: AI analyzes primary keys, foreign keys, indexes, and constraints to preserve data integrity.

steps.title: Data Type Mapping
steps.description: Automatic conversion of MSSQL types to target warehouse types (e.g., DATETIME2 → TIMESTAMP_NTZ).

steps.title: dbt Model Generation
steps.description: Creates staging models, intermediate transformations, and mart models following dbt best practices.

apiReference.title: API Reference
apiReference.description: Complete API documentation for integrating with DataMigrate AI.
apiReference.overview: RESTful API for programmatic access to all DataMigrate AI features.

steps.title: Authentication
steps.description: Use Bearer token authentication. Get your API key from Settings > API Keys.

steps.title: Core Endpoints
steps.description:
POST /api/v1/migrations - Create migration
GET /api/v1/migrations - List migrations
GET /api/v1/migrations/:id - Get migration details

steps.title: Rate Limits
steps.description: 100 requests per minute for standard accounts. Enterprise accounts have unlimited requests.

steps.title: Webhooks
steps.description: Configure webhooks to receive notifications when migrations complete or fail.

bestPractices.title: Best Practices
bestPractices.description: Guidelines for optimizing your data migrations and dbt projects.
bestPractices.overview: Follow these guidelines to ensure smooth migrations and maintainable dbt projects.

steps.title: Start Small
steps.description: Begin with a few tables to test the process. Expand once you're comfortable with the workflow.

steps.title: Review Generated Code
steps.description: Always review AI-generated dbt models. Add custom business logic as needed.

steps.title: Test Incrementally
steps.description: Run dbt tests after each migration batch. Fix issues before proceeding.

steps.title: Version Control
steps.description: Commit generated dbt projects to Git. Track changes and enable collaboration.

troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting
troubleshooting.description: Common issues and solutions for DataMigrate AI.
troubleshooting.overview: Solutions to common problems encountered during migrations.

steps.title: Connection Timeout
steps.description: Check firewall rules, verify server is accessible, and ensure correct port (default 1433).

steps.title: Authentication Failed
steps.description: Verify credentials, check SQL Server authentication mode, and ensure user has required permissions.

steps.title: Migration Stuck
steps.description: Large tables may take time. Check progress in migration details. Contact support if no progress for 30+ minutes.

steps.title: Type Conversion Errors
steps.description: Some custom types may need manual mapping. Check the error log for specific column issues.
